instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: have a second 3115.  It is missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> i have no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_EN</SIGNAL> i have no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_EN</SIGNAL>. serious liquid damaged corrosion throughout the board. i replaced anything that looked fried/ burnt. the boards fan spins for a second then turns off. if i smc by pass the fan stay on.  <CHIP>U4800</CHIP> are was corroded. replaced it and no change. ppbus is good at 12v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: If the fan spins then <SIGNAL>SLP_S3</SIGNAL> must  be there. Could be anything, the usual suspects are clock chip or crap under SMC. But if board was corroded all over it can be anything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
okay thanks. the fan spins only for a few seconds then it stops entirely. i did replace the clock chip as it was nasty and there was stuff near smc so i guess i will try a reflow there.  for some reason when tracking down the issue with <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> i found that <SIGNAL>SLP_S3</SIGNAL> was not there but i must be doing things in the wrong order. i will go through and if the smc reflow/replacememt doesn't work i will replace everything with corrosion near it. 
Thanks again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: It is power cycling. Again, Could be anything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: no no power cycling. just a quick spin and stops.  I am aware of that.  am going to try the smc and work from there. Cheers
